task.title: Creating map lists
task.shortdesc: Use map lists to build multiple sets of maps at once. This lets you create smaller, more manageable maps, for example factored by audience or information type, yet still produce output with all the necessary related links and navigation.

step.cmd: Open Windows Explorer to the directory that contains your maps.
Right-click in the right-hand pane and select New DITA Map List.
Provide a name for the new map list.
Double-click on the map list file to open it.
step.stepresult: The map list editor has two separate lists for maps you want to use for navigation and maps you want to use for linking.

step.cmd: Click Add to select the maps you want to use for each purpose.
step.info: If you want a map to behave the same as it would if built directly (generating both navigation and links), you will need to add it to both lists.

step.cmd: Save and close the map list.
Right-click the map list and select Work with ID Workbench.
Select the profile for the kind of output you want, or create a new profile.
Click Run to produce output based on the selected profile.

taskbody.result: In PDF or HTMLHelp output, you will get a single file with the contents organized based on the sequence of the navigation maps. In Eclipse output, you will get navigation files generated from the navigation maps, but you will need to set the sequence of the navigation files either in a plugin.xml file or another navigation file that references the generated ones.
